intro: Chenopodina physophora, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often resembling a cushion. Its leaves are typically succulent and adapted to conserve water, reflecting its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Chenopodina physophora plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
